melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, drink in the Ambrosial Nectar of the Lord.

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. The feelings instilled by this Raag can be compared to those of a bride on the day of her wedding; she is happy and sad. Although she is going to her groom, who fills her with hope and joy, she is also sad to be leaving her family.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਨਾ ਜੀਉ ਮਰੈ ਨ ਕਬਹੂ ਛੀਜੈ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The soul does not die, nor does it ever waste away. ||1||

transliteration.text: nā jīu marai n kabahū shījai .1.

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. The feelings instilled by this Raag can be compared to those of a bride on the day of her wedding; she is happy and sad. Although she is going to her groom, who fills her with hope and joy, she is also sad to be leaving her family.

translation.text: By great good fortune, one meets the Perfect Guru.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਤੇ ਪ੍ਰਭੂ ਧਿਆਈਐ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, one meditates on God. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: gur kirapā tē prabhū dhiāīai .1. rahāu .

translation.text: The Lord is the jewel, the pearl, the gem, the diamond.

translation.text: Meditating, meditating in remembrance on God, I am in ecstasy. ||2||

translation.text: Wherever I look, I see the Sanctuary of the Holy.

text: ਹਰਿ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਇ ਨਿਰਮਲ ਮਨੁ ਕਰਣਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, my soul becomes immaculately pure. ||3||

transliteration.text: har gun gāi niramal man karanā .3.

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. text: ਘਟ ਘਟ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਮੇਰਾ ਸੁਆਮੀ ਵੂਠਾ ॥

translation.text: Within each and every heart, dwells my Lord and Master.

transliteration.text: ghat ghat antar mērā suāmī vūthā .

translation.text: O Nanak, one obtains the Naam, the Name of the Lord, when God bestows His Mercy. ||4||6||
